snippet.textDisplay:
@Arc13 
True, MM1 is the precursor, so we can forgive it.  :P
I was only saying that MM4-6 are more polished game than the 1st imo, but it's ok since it's the great-grandfather of MM games: it hasn't aged well, but you gotta respect your origins. ^__^

I never implied MM4-6 were better than 2-3 though... So yeah, you're pretty much right on this example.

And sorry, didn't see that last sentence on your original comment. Twice, it seems... :\
snippet.textOriginal:
@Arc13 
True, MM1 is the precursor, so we can forgive it.  :P
I was only saying that MM4-6 are more polished game than the 1st imo, but it's ok since it's the great-grandfather of MM games: it hasn't aged well, but you gotta respect your origins. ^__^

I never implied MM4-6 were better than 2-3 though... So yeah, you're pretty much right on this example.

And sorry, didn't see that last sentence on your original comment. Twice, it seems... :\

snippet.textDisplay: On the Internet at least, the general consensus is that MM2 and 3 were the best and that the others were all inferior, though each game has its proponents. Everyone seems to mostly want to forget about MM1, which, let's be honest, was a glitchy mess.
snippet.textOriginal: On the Internet at least, the general consensus is that MM2 and 3 were the best and that the others were all inferior, though each game has its proponents. Everyone seems to mostly want to forget about MM1, which, let's be honest, was a glitchy mess.

snippet.textDisplay:
Why is it so many mascots die/lose their edge that made them famous after 3 games?
Earthworm Jim
Crash Bandicoot
Sonic The Hedgehog
Spyro The Dragon
Donkey Kong
Mega Man
Timesplitters
Rayman
Jak & Daxter
I can go on... Nice to see some of them returning after eons. Rest in peace for the rest of them.

snippet.textDisplay: I actually got to meet Tommy Tallarico at the VGL Concert in New Orleans a few years back. I must say, he's a really nice guy. Funny too! It was really cool learning about how EJ came to be and how its soundtrack came to be as well, since I played it so much as a little girl. I love this song so much, its probably one of my favorites of the series.
snippet.textOriginal: I actually got to meet Tommy Tallarico at the VGL Concert in New Orleans a few years back. I must say, he's a really nice guy. Funny too! I love this song so much, its probably one of my favorites of the series.

snippet.textDisplay:
I played this one on the SNES originally and really liked the unique atmosphere with great music by Tallarico. Great humor too. I know some people prefer the SNES version and others the Genesis version. Since I like all the versions, I went with the neutral PC version. ;)

I'll always remember the Villi People stage in EJ2 with the strangely fitting Moonlight Sonata music playing, that stage was pretty hard as a kid.
